Loving Obedience

True obedience springs from love, not fear or obligation. It’s the natural response of a heart transformed by the grace of God. Instead of being burdensome, obedience becomes a delight when love for Jesus fills the heart.

Love is the Fulfilment of the Law

Jesus said in John 14:15,

“If ye love me, keep my commandments.”

Obedience isn't a way to earn salvation; it’s the evidence of it. When we truly love Jesus, we naturally desire to do what pleases Him. Love is the foundation of every true act of obedience.

Romans 13:10 affirms that“love is the fulfilling of the law.” God's commandments are rooted in love—for Him and for others. The Ten Commandments teach us how to love in action, not just in words. Without love, obedience becomes empty and lifeless.

Ellen G. White writes in Steps to Christ, p. 60:

“Obedience—the service and allegiance of love—is the true sign of discipleship.”

Loving obedience reveals a new heart. We obey not to be saved, but because we are saved and want to live in harmony with our Savior.

1 John 5:3 assures us that “his commandments are not grievous.” When love motivates us, obedience is not a chore but a joy. The more we walk with Christ, the more we delight to do His will, and His law becomes written on our hearts.

Love is the Heart of All

Loving obedience is the heartbeat of the Christian life. It's the outward expression of a transformed heart and the clearest sign that Christ reigns within. Obeying God’s law out of love brings peace, joy, and lasting fellowship with the One who gave all for us.

References

  1. Bible: John 14:15; Romans 13:10; 1 John 5:3
  2. Spirit of Prophecy: Steps to Christ, p. 60
